context_bundle.summary: BBRv2 (Bottleneck Bandwidth and Round-trip propagation time) - Google's TCP congestion control algorithm. Models network path instead of relying on packet loss. Excellent for satellite links (Starlink) and high-BDP paths. Prevents bufferbloat by not overfilling buffers.

onboarding.quick_start: BBR is configured at the OS/router level. ASUS routers with Merlin firmware support BBR. Combined with router SQM/QoS for best bufferbloat prevention.
common_patterns: BBR models bandwidth + RTT, not packet loss
Better than CUBIC for variable latency (satellite)
Keeps buffers from bloating under load
Works well with high bandwidth-delay product links

known_errors.cause: Using loss-based congestion control (CUBIC) without SQM
known_errors.solution: Enable BBR or configure router SQM/QoS
known_errors.prevention: Test with DSLReports or Waveform bufferbloat test

comparison.vs_cubic: CUBIC reacts to loss, BBR probes for bandwidth
